quote: king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty and despair!
I met a traveller from an antique land
Wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command
How the youthful harlot’s curse / Blasts the newborn infant’s tear
The hapless soldier’s sigh/Runs in blood down palace walls
Strode after me. With trembling oars i turned
No familiar shapes/ Remained, no pleasant images of trees
It was an act of stealth; and troubled pleasure
I gave commands; / Then all smiles stopped together.
Sudden successive flights of bullets streak the silence
Charging an army, while / All the world wonder'd
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Theirs not to make reply, / Theirs not to reason why, / Theirs but to do and die
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Into the jaws of Death, / Into the mouth of Hell
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson
